intro: Ferulago bourgaei, commonly known as the Cape Verde ferula, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and distinctive umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and has adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Ferulago bourgaei is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
